etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "person") duplicated + 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") as semantic = following people walking together -> "follow"; phonetic: 从(cong, "follow")
etymology.interpretation: The character 从(cóng, "from") visually depicts two people walking in the same direction, symbolizing following someone. In its traditional form, 從(cong, "follow") added the "walk" radical to reinforce the idea of movement and accompaniment.
etymology.simplification: 从 was retained as a shorthand for 從 by omitting the 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") radical, preserving its original depiction of two people walking.

examples.chinese: 我从学校回来(我從學校回來)。
他从乡村出发(他從鄉村出發)，前往都市(前往都市)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng xiāngcūn chūfā, qiánwǎng dūshì.
examples.english: He set off from the countryside, heading to the city.
